content.text:
> - discussions and bug tracker stuff goes on a dedicated forum (â€¦Loomio? SSB? idk)

I just remembered that npm uses Discourse for this and it [seems to work well](https://npm.community/). I'm going to read their [meta discussions](https://npm.community/c/meta) and see if I can glean any useful info, but this looks like it might be a reasonable way for the SSBC to coordinate discussion/development/maintenance/support with the community without requiring a working SSB installation *or* depending on GitHub. It's worth noting that they still use GitHub for [pull requests](https://github.com/npm/cli/pulls), but other discussions happen on Discourse.
